00028 /* Some portions are extracted from llapi_layout_test.c */
00029 
00030 /* The purpose of this test is to check some HSM functions. HSM must
00031  * be enabled before running it:
00032  *   lctl set_param mdt.$FSNAME-MDT0000.hsm_control=enabled
00033  */
00034 
00035 /* All tests return 0 on success and non zero on error. The program will
00036  * exit as soon a non zero error is returned. */
00037 
00038 #include <stdlib.h>
00039 #include <errno.h>
00040 #include <getopt.h>
00041 #include <fcntl.h>
00042 #include <unistd.h>
00043 #include <poll.h>
00044 #include <time.h>
00045 
00046 #include <lustre/lustreapi.h>
00047 
00048 static char fsmountdir[PATH_MAX];      /* Lustre mountpoint */
00049 static char *lustre_dir;               /* Test directory inside Lustre */
00050 
00051 #define ERROR(fmt, ...)                                                 \
00052         fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s:%d: %s: " fmt "\n",                     \
00053                 program_invocation_short_name, __FILE__, __LINE__,      \
00054                 __func__, ## __VA_ARGS__);
00055 
00056 #define DIE(fmt, ...)                           \
00057         do {                                    \
00058                 ERROR(fmt, ## __VA_ARGS__);     \
00059                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);             \
00060         } while (0)
00061 
00062 #define ASSERTF(cond, fmt, ...)                                         \
00063         do {                                                            \
00064                 if (!(cond))                                            \
00065                         DIE("assertion '%s' failed: "fmt,               \
00066                             #cond, ## __VA_ARGS__);                     \
00067         } while (0)                                                     \
00068 
00069 #define PERFORM(testfn) \
00070         do {                                                            \
00071                 fprintf(stderr, "Starting test " #testfn " at %llu\n",  \
00072                         (unsigned long long)time(NULL));                \
00073                 testfn();                                               \
00074                 fprintf(stderr, "Finishing test " #testfn " at %llu\n", \
00075                        (unsigned long long)time(NULL));                 \
00076         } while (0)
00077 
00078 /* Register and unregister 2000 times. Ensures there is no fd leak
00079  * since there is usually 1024 fd per process. */
00080 int test1(void)
00081 {
00082         int i;
00083         int rc;
00084         struct hsm_copytool_private *ctdata;
00085 
00086         for (i = 0; i < 2000; i++) {
00087                 rc = llapi_hsm_copytool_register(&ctdata, fsmountdir,
00088                                                  0, NULL, 0);
00089                 ASSERTF(rc == 0,
00090                         "llapi_hsm_copytool_register failed: %s, loop=%d",
00091                         strerror(-rc), i);
00092 
00093                 rc = llapi_hsm_copytool_unregister(&ctdata);
00094                 ASSERTF(rc == 0,
00095                         "llapi_hsm_copytool_unregister failed: %s, loop=%d",
00096                         strerror(-rc), i);
00097         }
00098 
00099         return 0;
00100 }
00101 
00102 /* Re-register */
00103 int test2(void)
00104 {
00105         int rc;
00106         struct hsm_copytool_private *ctdata1;
00107         struct hsm_copytool_private *ctdata2;
00108 
00109         rc = llapi_hsm_copytool_register(&ctdata1, fsmountdir, 0, NULL, 0);
00110         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_copytool_register failed: %s",
00111                 strerror(-rc));
00112 
00113         rc = llapi_hsm_copytool_register(&ctdata2, fsmountdir, 0, NULL, 0);
00114         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_copytool_register failed: %s",
00115                 strerror(-rc));
00116 
00117         rc = llapi_hsm_copytool_unregister(&ctdata2);
00118         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_copytool_unregister failed: %s",
00119                 strerror(-rc));
00120 
00121         rc = llapi_hsm_copytool_unregister(&ctdata1);
00122         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_copytool_unregister failed: %s",
00123                 strerror(-rc));
00124 
00125         return 0;
00126 }

00128 /* Bad parameters to llapi_hsm_copytool_register(). */
00129 int test3(void)
00130 {
00131         int rc;
00132         struct hsm_copytool_private *ctdata;
00133         int archives[33];
00134 
00135         rc = llapi_hsm_copytool_register(&ctdata, fsmountdir, 1, NULL, 0);
00136         ASSERTF(rc == -EINVAL, "llapi_hsm_copytool_register error: %s",
00137                 strerror(-rc));
00138 
00139         rc = llapi_hsm_copytool_register(&ctdata, fsmountdir, 33, NULL, 0);
00140         ASSERTF(rc == -EINVAL, "llapi_hsm_copytool_register error: %s",
00141                 strerror(-rc));
00142 
00143         memset(archives, 1, sizeof(archives));
00144         rc = llapi_hsm_copytool_register(&ctdata, fsmountdir, 34, archives, 0);
00145         ASSERTF(rc == -EINVAL, "llapi_hsm_copytool_register error: %s",
00146                 strerror(-rc));
00147 
00148 #if 0
00149         /* BUG? Should that fail or not? */
00150         rc = llapi_hsm_copytool_register(&ctdata, fsmountdir, -1, NULL, 0);
00151         ASSERTF(rc == -EINVAL, "llapi_hsm_copytool_register error: %s",
00152                 strerror(-rc));
00153 #endif
00154 
00155         memset(archives, -1, sizeof(archives));
00156         rc = llapi_hsm_copytool_register(&ctdata, fsmountdir, 1, archives, 0);
00157         ASSERTF(rc == -EINVAL, "llapi_hsm_copytool_register error: %s",
00158                 strerror(-rc));
00159 
00160         rc = llapi_hsm_copytool_register(&ctdata, "/tmp", 0, NULL, 0);
00161         ASSERTF(rc == -ENOENT, "llapi_hsm_copytool_register error: %s",
00162                 strerror(-rc));
00163 
00164         return 0;
00165 }

00179 /* Test llapi_hsm_copytool_recv in non blocking mode */
00180 int test5(void)
00181 {
00182         int rc;
00183         int i;
00184         struct hsm_copytool_private *ctdata;
00185         struct hsm_action_list  *hal;
00186         int msgsize;
00187 
00188         rc = llapi_hsm_copytool_register(&ctdata, fsmountdir,
00189                                          0, NULL, O_NONBLOCK);
00190         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_copytool_unregister failed: %s",
00191                 strerror(-rc));
00192 
00193         /* Hopefully there is nothing lingering */
00194         for (i = 0; i < 1000; i++) {
00195                 rc = llapi_hsm_copytool_recv(ctdata, &hal, &msgsize);
00196                 ASSERTF(rc == -EWOULDBLOCK, "llapi_hsm_copytool_recv error: %s",
00197                         strerror(-rc));
00198         }
00199 
00200         rc = llapi_hsm_copytool_unregister(&ctdata);
00201         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_copytool_unregister failed: %s",
00202                 strerror(-rc));
00203 
00204         return 0;
00205 }

00242 /* Test polling (without actual traffic) */
00243 int test7(void)
00244 {
00245         int rc;
00246         struct hsm_copytool_private *ctdata;
00247         struct hsm_action_list  *hal;
00248         int msgsize;
00249         int fd;
00250         struct pollfd fds[1];
00251 
00252         rc = llapi_hsm_copytool_register(&ctdata, fsmountdir,
00253                                          0, NULL, O_NONBLOCK);
00254         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_copytool_register failed: %s",
00255                 strerror(-rc));
00256 
00257         fd = llapi_hsm_copytool_get_fd(ctdata);
00258         ASSERTF(fd >= 0, "llapi_hsm_copytool_get_fd failed: %s",
00259                 strerror(-rc));
00260 
00261         /* Ensure it's read-only */
00262         rc = write(fd, &rc, 1);
00263         ASSERTF(rc == -1 && errno == EBADF, "write error: %d, %s",
00264                 rc, strerror(errno));
00265 
00266         rc = llapi_hsm_copytool_recv(ctdata, &hal, &msgsize);
00267         ASSERTF(rc == -EWOULDBLOCK, "llapi_hsm_copytool_recv error: %s",
00268                 strerror(-rc));
00269 
00270         fds[0].fd = fd;
00271         fds[0].events = POLLIN;
00272         rc = poll(fds, 1, 10);
00273         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "poll failed: %d, %s",
00274                 rc, strerror(errno)); /* no event */
00275 
00276         rc = llapi_hsm_copytool_unregister(&ctdata);
00277         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_copytool_unregister failed: %s",
00278                 strerror(-rc));
00279 
00280         return 0;
00281 }
00282 
00283 /* Create the testfile of a given length. It returns a valid file
00284  * descriptor. */
00285 static char testfile[PATH_MAX];
00286 static int create_testfile(size_t length)
00287 {
00288         int rc;
00289         int fd;
00290 
00291         rc = snprintf(testfile, sizeof(testfile), "%s/hsm_check_test",
00292                       lustre_dir);
00293         ASSERTF((rc > 0 && rc < sizeof(testfile)), "invalid name for testfile");
00294 
00295         /* Remove old test file, if any. */
00296         unlink(testfile);
00297 
00298         /* Use truncate so we can create a file (almost) as big as we
00299          * want, while taking 0 bytes of data. */
00300         fd = creat(testfile, S_IRWXU);
00301         ASSERTF(fd >= 0, "create failed for '%s': %s",
00302                 testfile, strerror(errno));
00303 
00304         rc = ftruncate(fd, length);
00305         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "ftruncate failed for '%s': %s",
00306                 testfile, strerror(errno));
00307 
00308         return fd;
00309 }
00310 
00311 /* Test llapi_hsm_state_get. */
00312 void test50(void)
00313 {
00314         struct hsm_user_state hus;
00315         int rc;
00316         int fd;
00317 
00318         fd = create_testfile(100);
00319 
00320         /* With fd variant */
00321         rc = llapi_hsm_state_get_fd(fd, &hus);
00322         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_state_get_fd failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00323         ASSERTF(hus.hus_states == 0, "state=%u", hus.hus_states);
00324 
00325         rc = llapi_hsm_state_get_fd(fd, NULL);
00326         ASSERTF(rc == -EFAULT, "llapi_hsm_state_get_fd error: %s",
00327                 strerror(-rc));
00328 
00329         rc = close(fd);
00330         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "close failed: %s", strerror(errno));
00331 
00332         /* Without fd */
00333         rc = llapi_hsm_state_get(testfile, &hus);
00334         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_state_get failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00335         ASSERTF(hus.hus_states == 0, "state=%u", hus.hus_states);
00336 
00337         rc = llapi_hsm_state_get(testfile, NULL);
00338         ASSERTF(rc == -EFAULT, "llapi_hsm_state_get error: %s",
00339                 strerror(-rc));
00340 
00341         memset(&hus, 0xaa, sizeof(hus));
00342         rc = llapi_hsm_state_get(testfile, &hus);
00343         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_state_get failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00344         ASSERTF(hus.hus_states == 0, "state=%u", hus.hus_states);
00345         ASSERTF(hus.hus_archive_id == 0, "archive_id=%u", hus.hus_archive_id);
00346         ASSERTF(hus.hus_in_progress_state == 0, "hus_in_progress_state=%u",
00347                 hus.hus_in_progress_state);
00348         ASSERTF(hus.hus_in_progress_action == 0, "hus_in_progress_action=%u",
00349                 hus.hus_in_progress_action);
00350 }
00351 
00352 /* Test llapi_hsm_state_set. */
00353 void test51(void)
00354 {
00355         int rc;
00356         int fd;
00357         int i;
00358         struct hsm_user_state hus;
00359 
00360         fd = create_testfile(100);
00361 
00362         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, 0, 0, 0);
00363         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00364 
00365         /* Set archive id */
00366         for (i = 0; i <= 32; i++) {
00367                 rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, HS_EXISTS, 0, i);
00368                 ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd failed: %s",
00369                         strerror(-rc));
00370 
00371                 rc = llapi_hsm_state_get_fd(fd, &hus);
00372                 ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd failed: %s",
00373                         strerror(-rc));
00374                 ASSERTF(hus.hus_states == HS_EXISTS, "state=%u",
00375                         hus.hus_states);
00376                 ASSERTF(hus.hus_archive_id == i, "archive_id=%u, i=%d",
00377                         hus.hus_archive_id, i);
00378         }
00379 
00380         /* Invalid archive numbers */
00381         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, HS_EXISTS, 0, 33);
00382         ASSERTF(rc == -EINVAL, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd: %s", strerror(-rc));
00383 
00384         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, HS_EXISTS, 0, 151);
00385         ASSERTF(rc == -EINVAL, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd: %s", strerror(-rc));
00386 
00387         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, HS_EXISTS, 0, -1789);
00388         ASSERTF(rc == -EINVAL, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd: %s", strerror(-rc));
00389 
00390         /* Settable flags, with respect of the HSM file state transition rules:
00391          *      DIRTY without EXISTS: no dirty if no archive was created
00392          *      DIRTY and RELEASED: a dirty file could not be released
00393          *      RELEASED without ARCHIVED: do not release a non-archived file
00394          *      LOST without ARCHIVED: cannot lost a non-archived file.
00395          */
00396         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, HS_DIRTY, 0, 0);
00397         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00398 
00399         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, 0, HS_EXISTS, 0);
00400         ASSERTF(rc == -EINVAL, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd failed: %s",
00401                 strerror(-rc));
00402 
00403         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, 0, HS_DIRTY, 0);
00404         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00405 
00406         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, 0, HS_EXISTS, 0);
00407         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00408 
00409         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, HS_DIRTY, 0, 0);
00410         ASSERTF(rc == -EINVAL, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd failed: %s",
00411                 strerror(-rc));
00412 
00413         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, HS_RELEASED, 0, 0);
00414         ASSERTF(rc == -EINVAL, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd failed: %s",
00415                 strerror(-rc));
00416 
00417         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, HS_LOST, 0, 0);
00418         ASSERTF(rc == -EINVAL, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd failed: %s",
00419                 strerror(-rc));
00420 
00421         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, HS_ARCHIVED, 0, 0);
00422         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00423 
00424         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, HS_RELEASED, 0, 0);
00425         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00426 
00427         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, HS_LOST, 0, 0);
00428         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00429 
00430         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, HS_DIRTY|HS_EXISTS, 0, 0);
00431         ASSERTF(rc == -EINVAL, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd failed: %s",
00432                 strerror(-rc));
00433 
00434         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, 0, HS_RELEASED, 0);
00435         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00436 
00437         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, HS_DIRTY|HS_EXISTS, 0, 0);
00438         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00439 
00440         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, 0, HS_ARCHIVED, 0);
00441         ASSERTF(rc == -EINVAL, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd failed: %s",
00442                 strerror(-rc));
00443 
00444         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, 0, HS_LOST, 0);
00445         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00446 
00447         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, 0, HS_ARCHIVED, 0);
00448         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00449 
00450         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, HS_NORELEASE, 0, 0);
00451         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00452 
00453         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, 0, HS_NORELEASE, 0);
00454         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00455 
00456         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, HS_NOARCHIVE, 0, 0);
00457         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00458 
00459         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, 0, HS_NOARCHIVE, 0);
00460         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00461 
00462         /* Bogus flags for good measure. */
00463         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, 0x00080000, 0, 0);
00464         ASSERTF(rc == -EINVAL, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd: %s", strerror(-rc));
00465 
00466         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, 0x80000000, 0, 0);
00467         ASSERTF(rc == -EINVAL, "llapi_hsm_state_set_fd: %s", strerror(-rc));
00468 
00469         close(fd);
00470 }
00471 
00472 /* Test llapi_hsm_current_action */
00473 void test52(void)
00474 {
00475         int rc;
00476         int fd;
00477         struct hsm_current_action hca;
00478 
00479         /* No fd equivalent, so close it. */
00480         fd = create_testfile(100);
00481         close(fd);
00482 
00483         rc = llapi_hsm_current_action(testfile, &hca);
00484         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_current_action failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00485         ASSERTF(hca.hca_state, "hca_state=%u", hca.hca_state);
00486         ASSERTF(hca.hca_action, "hca_state=%u", hca.hca_action);
00487 
00488         rc = llapi_hsm_current_action(testfile, NULL);
00489         ASSERTF(rc == -EFAULT, "llapi_hsm_current_action failed: %s",
00490                 strerror(-rc));
00491 }
00492 
00493 /* Helper to simulate archiving a file. No actual data movement
00494  * happens. */
00495 void helper_archiving(void (*progress)
00496                       (struct hsm_copyaction_private *hcp, size_t length),
00497                       const size_t length)
00498 {
00499         int rc;
00500         int fd;
00501         struct hsm_copytool_private *ctdata;
00502         struct hsm_user_request *hur;
00503         struct hsm_action_list  *hal;
00504         struct hsm_action_item  *hai;
00505         int                      msgsize;
00506         struct hsm_copyaction_private *hcp;
00507         struct hsm_user_state hus;
00508 
00509         fd = create_testfile(length);
00510 
00511         rc = llapi_hsm_copytool_register(&ctdata, fsmountdir,
00512                                          0, NULL, 0);
00513         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_copytool_register failed: %s",
00514                 strerror(-rc));
00515 
00516         /* Create and send the archive request. */
00517         hur = llapi_hsm_user_request_alloc(1, 0);
00518         ASSERTF(hur != NULL, "llapi_hsm_user_request_alloc returned NULL");
00519 
00520         hur->hur_request.hr_action = HUA_ARCHIVE;
00521         hur->hur_request.hr_archive_id = 1;
00522         hur->hur_request.hr_flags = 0;
00523         hur->hur_request.hr_itemcount = 1;
00524         hur->hur_request.hr_data_len = 0;
00525         hur->hur_user_item[0].hui_extent.offset = 0;
00526         hur->hur_user_item[0].hui_extent.length = -1;
00527 
00528         rc = llapi_fd2fid(fd, &hur->hur_user_item[0].hui_fid);
00529         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_fd2fid failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00530 
00531         close(fd);
00532 
00533         rc = llapi_hsm_request(testfile, hur);
00534         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_request failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00535 
00536         free(hur);
00537 
00538         /* Read the request */
00539         rc = llapi_hsm_copytool_recv(ctdata, &hal, &msgsize);
00540         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_copytool_recv failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00541         ASSERTF(hal->hal_count == 1, "hal_count=%d", hal->hal_count);
00542 
00543         hai = hai_first(hal);
00544         ASSERTF(hai != NULL, "hai_first returned NULL");
00545         ASSERTF(hai->hai_action == HSMA_ARCHIVE,
00546                 "hai_action=%d", hai->hai_action);
00547 
00548         /* "Begin" archiving */
00549         hcp = NULL;
00550         rc = llapi_hsm_action_begin(&hcp, ctdata, hai, -1, 0, false);
00551         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_action_begin failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00552         ASSERTF(hcp != NULL, "hcp is NULL");
00553 
00554         if (progress)
00555                 progress(hcp, length);
00556 
00557         /* Done archiving */
00558         rc = llapi_hsm_action_end(&hcp, &hai->hai_extent, 0, 0);
00559         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_action_end failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00560         ASSERTF(hcp == NULL, "hcp is NULL");
00561 
00562         /* Close HSM client */
00563         rc = llapi_hsm_copytool_unregister(&ctdata);
00564         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_copytool_unregister failed: %s",
00565                 strerror(-rc));
00566 
00567         /* Final check */
00568         rc = llapi_hsm_state_get(testfile, &hus);
00569         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_state_get failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00570         ASSERTF(hus.hus_states == (HS_EXISTS | HS_ARCHIVED),
00571                 "state=%u", hus.hus_states);
00572 }
00573 
00574 /* Simple archive. No progress. */
00575 void test100(void)
00576 {
00577         const size_t length = 100;
00578 
00579         helper_archiving(NULL, length);
00580 }
00581 
00582 /* Archive, with a report every byte. */
00583 static void test101_progress(struct hsm_copyaction_private *hcp, size_t length)
00584 {
00585         int i;
00586         int rc;
00587         struct hsm_extent he;
00588         struct hsm_current_action hca;
00589 
00590         /* Report progress. 1 byte at a time :) */
00591         for (i = 0; i < length; i++) {
00592                 he.offset = i;
00593                 he.length = 1;
00594                 rc = llapi_hsm_action_progress(hcp, &he, length, 0);
00595                 ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_action_progress failed: %s",
00596                         strerror(-rc));
00597         }
00598 
00599         rc = llapi_hsm_current_action(testfile, &hca);
00600         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_current_action failed: %s",
00601                 strerror(-rc));
00602         ASSERTF(hca.hca_state == HPS_RUNNING,
00603                 "hca_state=%u", hca.hca_state);
00604         ASSERTF(hca.hca_action == HUA_ARCHIVE,
00605                 "hca_state=%u", hca.hca_action);
00606         ASSERTF(hca.hca_location.length == length,
00607                 "length=%llu", (unsigned long long)hca.hca_location.length);
00608 }
00609

00720 /* Archive, with 1 bogus report. */
00721 static void test105_progress(struct hsm_copyaction_private *hcp, size_t length)
00722 {
00723         int rc;
00724         struct hsm_extent he;
00725         struct hsm_current_action hca;
00726 
00727         he.offset = 2*length;
00728         he.length = 10*length;
00729         rc = llapi_hsm_action_progress(hcp, &he, length, 0);
00730         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_action_progress failed: %s",
00731                 strerror(-rc));
00732 
00733         rc = llapi_hsm_current_action(testfile, &hca);
00734         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_current_action failed: %s",
00735                 strerror(-rc));
00736         ASSERTF(hca.hca_state == HPS_RUNNING,
00737                 "hca_state=%u", hca.hca_state);
00738         ASSERTF(hca.hca_action == HUA_ARCHIVE,
00739                 "hca_state=%u", hca.hca_action);
00740 
00741         /* BUG - offset should be 2*length, or length should
00742          * be 8*length */
00743         ASSERTF(hca.hca_location.length == 10*length,
00744                 "length=%llu", (unsigned long long)hca.hca_location.length);
00745 }

00888 
00889         for (i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
00890                 he.offset = i*length/10;
00891                 he.length = length/10;
00892                 rc = llapi_hsm_action_progress(hcp, &he, length, 0);
00893                 ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_action_progress failed: %s",
00894                         strerror(-rc));
00895 
00896                 rc = llapi_hsm_current_action(testfile, &hca);

00916 /* Archive, with 10 reports in reverse order, checking progress. */
00917 static void test111_progress(struct hsm_copyaction_private *hcp, size_t length)

00928                 ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_action_progress failed: %s",
00929                         strerror(-rc));

00933                         strerror(-rc));

00935                         "hca_state=%u", hca.hca_state);
00936                 ASSERTF(hca.hca_action == HUA_ARCHIVE,

00951 /* Archive, with 10 reports, and duplicating them, checking
00952  * progress. */
00953 static void test112_progress(struct hsm_copyaction_private *hcp, size_t length)
00954 {
00955         int rc;
00956         int i;
00957         struct hsm_extent he;
00958         struct hsm_current_action hca;
00959 
00960         for (i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
00961                 he.offset = i*length/10;
00962                 he.length = length/10;
00963                 rc = llapi_hsm_action_progress(hcp, &he, length, 0);
00964                 ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_action_progress failed: %s",
00965                         strerror(-rc));
00966 
00967                 rc = llapi_hsm_current_action(testfile, &hca);
00968                 ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_current_action failed: %s",
00969                         strerror(-rc));
00970                 ASSERTF(hca.hca_state == HPS_RUNNING,
00971                         "hca_state=%u", hca.hca_state);
00972                 ASSERTF(hca.hca_action == HUA_ARCHIVE,
00973                         "hca_state=%u", hca.hca_action);
00974                 ASSERTF(hca.hca_location.length == (i+1)*length/10,
00975                         "i=%d, length=%llu",
00976                         i, (unsigned long long)hca.hca_location.length);
00977         }
00978 
00979         for (i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
00980                 he.offset = i*length/10;
00981                 he.length = length/10;
00982                 rc = llapi_hsm_action_progress(hcp, &he, length, 0);
00983                 ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_action_progress failed: %s",
00984                         strerror(-rc));
00985 
00986                 rc = llapi_hsm_current_action(testfile, &hca);
00987                 ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_hsm_current_action failed: %s",
00988                         strerror(-rc));
00989                 ASSERTF(hca.hca_state == HPS_RUNNING,
00990                         "hca_state=%u", hca.hca_state);
00991                 ASSERTF(hca.hca_action == HUA_ARCHIVE,
00992                         "hca_state=%u", hca.hca_action);
00993                 ASSERTF(hca.hca_location.length == length,
00994                         "i=%d, length=%llu",
00995                         i, (unsigned long long)hca.hca_location.length);
00996         }
00997 }

01005 
01006 static void usage(char *prog)
01007 {
01008         fprintf(stderr, "Usage: %s [-d lustre_dir]\n", prog);
01009         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
01010 }
01011 
01012 static void process_args(int argc, char *argv[])
01013 {
01014         int c;
01015 
01016         while ((c = getopt(argc, argv, "d:")) != -1) {
01017                 switch (c) {
01018                 case 'd':
01019                         lustre_dir = optarg;
01020                         break;
01021                 case '?':
01022                 default:
01023                         fprintf(stderr, "Unknown option '%c'\n", optopt);
01024                         usage(argv[0]);
01025                         break;
01026                 }
01027         }
01028 }
01029 
01030 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
01031 {
01032         char fsname[8 + 1];
01033         int rc;
01034 
01035         process_args(argc, argv);
01036         if (lustre_dir == NULL)
01037                 lustre_dir = "/mnt/lustre";
01038 
01039         rc = llapi_search_mounts(lustre_dir, 0, fsmountdir, fsname);
01040         if (rc != 0) {
01041                 fprintf(stderr, "Error: %s: not a Lustre filesystem\n",
01042                         lustre_dir);
01043                 return EXIT_FAILURE;
01044         }
01045 
01046         /* Play nice with Lustre test scripts. Non-line buffered output
01047          * stream under I/O redirection may appear incorrectly. */
01048         setvbuf(stdout, NULL, _IOLBF, 0);
01049 
01050         PERFORM(test1);
01051         PERFORM(test2);
01052         PERFORM(test3);
01053         PERFORM(test4);
01054         PERFORM(test5);
01055         PERFORM(test6);
01056         PERFORM(test7);
01057         PERFORM(test50);
01058         PERFORM(test51);
01059         PERFORM(test52);
01060         PERFORM(test100);
01061         PERFORM(test101);
01062         PERFORM(test102);
01063         PERFORM(test103);
01064         PERFORM(test104);
01065         PERFORM(test105);
01066         PERFORM(test106);
01067         PERFORM(test107);
01068         PERFORM(test108);
01069         PERFORM(test109);
01070         PERFORM(test110);
01071         PERFORM(test111);
01072         PERFORM(test112);
01073 
01074         return EXIT_SUCCESS;
01075 }
